etymologies: mid 19th century: from French, from cadastre ‘register of property’, from Provençal cadastro, from Italian catastro (earlier catastico), from late Greek katastikhon ‘list, register’, from kata stikhon ‘line by line’

definitions: (of a map or survey) showing the extent, value, and ownership of land, especially for taxation.
shortDefinitions: (of map or survey) showing extent, value, and ownership of land
